author: S Prasad
text:
The party will register not less than 40 per cent of votes, he says

Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) founder S. Ramadoss on Thursday claimed that PMK would register not less than 40 per cent of votes if the elections are held even in January.

Addressing the general council meeting at Thailapuram, Dr. Ramadoss said that the party has made its presence felt in the State for the last 26 years.

“Had the party decided to contest elections on its own in the past it would have come to power. We have already tendered our apology to the people for having allied with either the DMK or the AIADMK,” Dr. Ramadoss said.

Describing both the DMK and AIADMK as ‘venomous,’ he said both the Dravidian parties would be rejected by the people in the forthcoming polls.

He maintained that the PMK was in an ‘alliance with the people.’

It would register not less than 40 per cent of votes even if the elections are held this month as the people had reposed faith and confidence in the party.

Social media

Mr. Ramadoss also stressed the need for using social media with the party functionaries in the context of the forthcoming Assembly polls.

Applications from aspirants seeking the party tickets in all the 234 Assembly Constituencies in the State would commence from January, he said.

PMK’s chief ministerial candidate Anbumani Ramadoss said the PMK was the only hope for the people to provide a clean and efficient government and is an alternative to the two Dravidian parties.

title: PMK’s alliance is with people, says Ramadoss
